medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute onset right lower quadrant (RLQ) abdominal pain lasting 12 hours.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient developed pain across the lower abdomen after lunch yesterday, describing it as a 'soreness'. The pain localized to the RLQ, is aggravated by movement, and is associated with the last bowel movement occurring the previous day. She has not passed flatus since yesterday morning. No nausea, appetite change, diarrhea, constipation, hematochezia, melena, fever, or chills were reported.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, Hyperlipidemia, Anxiety, possible COPD, Vertigo on lying flat, Inflammatory Bowel Disease.
medical_history.family_history: Denies history of gastrointestinal malignancy or inflammatory bowel disease.
